DC Fire Stations

I'm not much into architecture, but fire stations always stick out to me. The tall bays for the trucks, the upstairs living quarters, and the requiste fire pole are all interesting design constraints for any building.

DC seems to have preserved a number of historic fire houses-- used now as restaurants, apartments and gyms.

I'd planned to track down and photograph each fire station and map them, but Mike Legeros has already documented them here. Thanks Mike!

Built by MappingVermont.
